doc.after: The Shangqing (Chinese: ä¸æ¸; pinyin: ShÃ ngqÄ«ng; literally: "Highest Clarity") school of Taoism began during the aristocracy of the Western Jin dynasty. The first leader of the school was Wei Huacun (251-334), but Tao Hongjing (456-536), who structured the theory and practice and compiled the canon, is often considered to be its true founder.
